results.title: Making Window Pictures
results.brief_description: In the Brisbane Creative Leisure Centre, conducted by the Cantrills, children are shown reproductions of stained glass windows and then make large transparent pictures with black paper, coloured cellophane, and other materials such as discarded x-ray pictures and textured fabric, with a minimum of instruction. These are taken indoors and fastened to window panes.

results.title: Making waves = Te upoko o te ika
results.creator_credit: Whetu Fala, Carol J Paewai, TopShelf Productions and Nga Kara Whetu
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “From spirit to spirit (A)”.
The story of the Te Upoko o te ika, Maori radio station in Wellington, New Zealand. The station fights to survive in a world where ratings and market share are paramount. This program captures one day in the life of a radio station which aims to bring Maori traditions, language and culture to the modern world.

results.title: Making Venus
results.creator_credit: Gary Doust, Tom Zubrycki, SBS Independent, Jotz Productions and Australian Film Commission
results.brief_description: This Australian documentary about filmmaking stands as a testament to everything that can possibly go wrong in the process of producing and directing a feature film. Cousins Jason Gooden and Julian Saggers are exuberant, if inexperienced, producers of their first low-budget feature called “The Venus factory”; they’ve raised $100 000 and plan to seek a distributor once the film is completed. This work follows the cousins over the next four years, displaying everything that can and does go wrong with the production - a chaotic shoot; an evolving script; investors, including friends and family, pouring more money into the flailing production; escalating costs; two directors (Glenn Fraser and Denis Whitburn); three title changes; numerous re-edits, re-writes and re-shoots; uninterested distributors; and finally, a scathing audience reaction. One cannot help but admire the producers’ tenacity, who despite fielding nasty letters from investors and crew, persist with dogged determination to finish their debut work. Displays the perils of guerrilla filmmaking, whilst providing a fascinating and raw insight into the mixed fortunes of a difficult business. This is the cinema version, containing twenty minutes of extra footage from the television cut.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gary Doust, Tom Zubrycki, SBS Independent, Jotz Productions and Australian Film Commission

results.title: Making tracks
results.creator_credit: Yoram Gross Films, David Muir, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A combination of live action photography and animation is used to impress users of off-road vehicles to ride and drive intelligently, so that Australia’s beautiful bushlands and wilderness areas do not suffer.

results.title: Making their senses make sense
results.creator_credit: Elsie McKibbin and Center for Developmental and Learning Disorders
results.brief_description: Discusses methods to care for and explores different activities to help teach children who are perceptually disabled. These children may find difficulty in learning, refining motor skills, and coping with safety aspects in everyday life.

results.title: Making the news; ABC news
results.brief_description: A two-part look at the production of ABC television news. In the first part Mary Delahunty takes us on a behind-the-scenes tour of the selection and production processes involved in the presentation of the news. The second part of the video is the actual news program which we have seen being put together in the first part.

results.title: Making the News
results.brief_description: Making the news is the most detailed study yet made of how a modern television newsroom operates. This video goes into detail of the technology resources, planning and decision making that makes up the production of a television news bulletin. Follow the role of each key player in the newsroom - the chief of staff, news director, journalists, camera-crews, network executives and graphics department. The video comprises seven segments:- Making the news; The bulletin; The reporter; Technology; Decisions; The presenters; Reflections on telling the news. Introduced by Mary Delahunty. A Teacher’s guide which includes question and stimulus sheets is available to accompany the video.

results.title: Making the most of your leisure
results.brief_description: The Sport and Recreation Service of New South Wales has centres throughout the state which encourage both adults and children to make the most of their leisure time. Specialised staff at the centres give instruction in many sports including: canoeing, archery, swimming lessons for adults, golf, skiing at Jindabyne in winter. Not only are active sports encouraged, but also the less active games such as chess.
